entry.title: The Flood Risk Management Overview and Scrutiny Committee (England) Regulations 2011
The Environment Agency (Levies) (England and Wales) Regulations 2011

ukm:Subject.Value: FLOOD RISK MANAGEMENT, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: FLOOD RISK MANAGEMENT, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: These Regulations provide for the issue of levies by the Environment Agency (“the Agency”) to lead local flood authorities under section 17(1) of the Flood and Water Management Act 2010 (“the 2010 Act”) in respect of the Agency’s flood and coastal erosion risk management functions under the 2010 Act. Section 17(3) of the 2010 Act provides that the Agency is a levying body within the meaning of section 74 of the Local Government Finance Act1974.

entry.title: The Regional Flood and Coastal Committees (England and Wales) Regulations 2011

ukm:Subject.Value: FLOOD RISK MANAGEMENT, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: FLOOD RISK MANAGEMENT, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: These Regulations make provision for the procedure to be followed by the Environment Agency when dividing England and Wales into regions under section 22(1)(a) of the Flood and Water Management Act 2010 (c. 29). They also make provision about appointment of members to Regional Flood and Coastal Committees and proceedings of those Committees.

entry.title: The Flood and Water Management Act 2010 (Commencement No. 3 and Transitional Provisions) Order 2011

ukm:Subject.Value: FLOOD RISK MANAGEMENT, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: FLOOD RISK MANAGEMENT, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: This Order brings into force provisions of the Flood and Water Management Act 2010 (“the Act”).

title.div: The Child Poverty Strategy (Wales) Regulations 2011 / Rheoliadau'r Strategaeth Tlodi Plant (Cymru) 2011

div.p: These Regulations come into force on 6 April 2011 and apply in Wales.
Daw'r Rheoliadau hyn i rym ar 6 Ebrill 2011 ac maent yn gymwys yng Nghymru.

title.div: The Education (Free School Lunches) (Prescribed Tax Credits) (Wales) (Amendment) Order 2011 / Gorchymyn Addysg (Ciniawau Ysgol am Ddim) (Credydau Treth Rhagnodedig) (Cymru) (Diwygio) 2011

div.p: This Order amends the Education (Free School Lunches) (Prescribed Tax Credits) (Wales) Order 2003.
Mae'r Gorchymyn hwn yn diwygio Gorchymyn Addysg (Ciniawau Ysgol Rhad ac am Ddim) (Credydau Treth Rhagnodedig) (Cymru) 2003.

entry.title: The Stamp Duty and Stamp Duty Reserve Tax (LCH.Clearnet Limited) Regulations 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations replace the corresponding regulations specified in the Schedule of Revocations to S.I. 2011 No. 665. They give relief from stamp duty and stamp duty reserve tax (“SDRT”) to certain transfers of, or agreements to transfer, traded securities or options made in the course of trading in those traded securities or options either on a facility or over the counter. The transfers and agreements eligible for relief are those involving LCH.Clearnet Limited (“LCH.Clearnet”), and its nominees, (through whom transactions on the facility are cleared) or clearing participants of LCH.Clearnet and its nominees.

entry.title: The Stamp Duty and Stamp Duty Reserve Tax (European Multilateral Clearing Facility N.V.) Regulations 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations replace the corresponding regulations specified in the Schedule of Revocations to S.I. 2011 No. 665. They give relief from stamp duty and stamp duty reserve tax (“SDRT”) to certain transfers of, or agreements to transfer, traded securities or options made in the course of trading in those traded securities or options either on a facility or over the counter. The transfers and agreements eligible for relief are those involving European Multilateral Clearing Facility N.V. (“EMCF”), and its nominees, (through whom transactions on the facility are cleared) or clearing participants of EMCF and its nominees.

entry.title: The Stamp Duty and Stamp Duty Reserve Tax (European Central Counterparty Limited) Regulations 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations replace the corresponding regulations specified in the Schedule of Revocations to S.I. 2011 No. 665. They give relief from stamp duty and stamp duty reserve tax (“SDRT”) to certain transfers of, or agreements to transfer, traded securities or options made in the course of trading in those traded securities or options either on a facility or over the counter. The transfers and agreements eligible for relief are those involving European Central Counterparty Limited (“EuroCCP”), and its nominees, (through whom transactions on the facility are cleared) or clearing participants of EuroCCP and its nominees.

entry.title: The Stamp Duty and Stamp Duty Reserve Tax (Eurex Clearing AG) Regulations 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations replace the corresponding regulations specified in the Schedule of Revocations to S.I. 2011 No. 665. They give relief from stamp duty and stamp duty reserve tax (“SDRT”) to certain transfers of, or agreements to transfer, traded securities or options made in the course of trading in those traded securities or options either on a facility or over the counter. The transfers and agreements eligible for relief are those involving Eurex Clearing AG (“Eurex”), and its nominees, (through whom transactions on the facility are cleared) or clearing participants of Eurex and its nominees.

entry.title: The Stamp Duty and Stamp Duty Reserve Tax (Investment Exchanges and Clearing Houses) (Revocation) Regulations 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations give relief from stamp duty and stamp duty reserve tax (“SDRT”) to those markets listed in the Schedule. The relief applies to prescribed recognised clearing houses and investment exchanges that fulfil a number of transactional conditions in order to be eligible for the relief.

entry.title: The Insurance Premium Tax (Discounted Insurance Premiums: Higher Rate) Order 2011

title.div: The Higher Education Act 2004 (Relevant Authority) (Designation) (Wales) Regulations 2011 / Rheoliadau Deddf Addysg Uwch 2004 (Awdurdod Perthnasol) (Dynodi) (Cymru) 2011

div.p: These Regulations designate the Higher Education Funding Council for Wales (“the Council”) as the relevant authority in relation to Wales for the purposes of section 30 of the Higher Education Act 2004 (“the Act”).
Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn dynodi Cyngor Cyllido Addysg Uwch Cymru (“y Cyngor”) yn awdurdod perthnasol o ran Cymru at ddibenion adran 30 o Ddeddf Addysg Uwch 2004 (“y Ddeddf”).

entry.title: The Pension Protection Fund (Prescribed Payments and Investment Costs – Amendment) Regulations 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Pension Protection Fund (Prescribed Payments) Regulations 2008 (S.I. 2008/664) (“the 2008 Regulations”) – regulation 2. They also revoke the Pension Protection Fund (Payments to meet Investment Costs) Regulations 2005 (S.I. 2005/1610) (“the 2005 Regulations”) – regulation 3. The provisions which were in the 2005 Regulations are included in the new provisions introduced by these Regulations into the 2008 Regulations.

entry.title: The Stamp Duty and Stamp Duty Reserve Tax (SIX X-CLEAR AG) Regulations 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations replace the corresponding regulations specified in the Schedule of Revocations to S.I. 2011 No. 665. They give relief from stamp duty and stamp duty reserve tax (“SDRT”) to certain transfers of, or agreements to transfer, traded securities or options made in the course of trading in those traded securities or options either on a facility or over the counter. The transfers and agreements eligible for relief are those involving SIX X-CLEAR AG (“X-CLEAR”), and its nominees, (through whom transactions on the facility are cleared) or clearing participants of X-CLEAR and its nominees.

entry.title: The Planning (General Development) (Amendment) Order (Northern Ireland) 2011
entry.summary: This Order amends the Planning (General Development) Order (Northern Ireland) 1993 (“the 1993 Order”).

title.div: The Cardiff and Vale College (Incorporation) Order 2011 / Gorchymyn Coleg Caerdydd a'r Fro (Corffori) 2011

div.p: This Order establishes a further education corporation called “Cardiff and Vale College” under section 16(1)(a) of the Further and Higher Education Act 1992 (“the Act”) for the purpose of conducting the educational institution of the same name. The Order also provides for the appointment of 1 August 2011 as the operative date for the purposes of Part 1 of the Act, being the date from which Cardiff and Vale College is to conduct the educational institution of the same name.

Mae'r Gorchymyn hwn yn sefydlu corfforaeth addysg bellach a elwir Coleg Caerdydd a'r Fro o dan adran 16(1)(a) o Ddeddf Addysg Bellach ac Uwch 1992 (“y Ddeddf”) at y diben o redeg y sefydliad addysgol sydd â'r un enw. Mae'r Gorchymyn hefyd yn darparu ar gyfer pennu 1 Awst 2011 yn ddyddiad gweithredu at ddibenion Rhan 1 o'r Ddeddf, sef y dyddiad y bydd Coleg Caerdydd a'r Fro yn ymgymryd â rhedeg, o hynny ymlaen, y sefydliad addysgol o'r un enw.

entry.title: The Tribunal Procedure (Amendment) Rules 2011

category.term: Special educational needs and additional support

entry.summary: These Rules amend the Tribunal Procedure Rules applied by the First-tier Tribunal and Upper Tribunal. Apart from minor amendments which maintain the commonality of the drafting, the changes are as follows.

entry.title: The Employment and Support Allowance (Limited Capability for Work and Limited Capability for Work-related Activity) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Employment and Support Allowance Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2008 relating to the work capability assessment. These Regulations substitute the descriptors and criteria applied to determine capability for work, and for work-related activity, and amend provisions which allow a person to be treated as having limited capability for work, or for work-related activity, without an assessment in certain circumstances.
